www.lawcommission.gov.np  
1 
 National Dalit Commission Act, 2074 (2017)  
Date of Authentication and Publication:                                            
October 15, 2017 ( 2074.06.29 )  
Amending Acts:   
 The Act Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)  March 3 , 2019 ( 2075.11.19 ) 
 
Act No. 24  of the year 2017  (2074)  
An Act Made to make arrangements relating to National Dalit 
Commission  
Preamble:  Whereas, it is expedient to make necessary arrangements relating 
to National Dalit Commission  for the  respect of the human rights of the Dalit 
commun ity as well as the  protection and promotion of the rights, interests of 
the Dalit community and the empowerment of the community and  to 
effectively include and mainstream them in nation building and development  
by ending caste based discrimination and untouchability , 
Now, therefore, be it enacted by the Federal Parliament pursuant to 
Article 296 sub -article (1) of the Constitution of Nepal.  
 
Chapter -1 
Preliminary  
 
1. Short title and Commencement : (1) This Act may be called " National 
Dalit  Commission  Act, 2017  (2074 )." 
  (2)  This act shall come into force immediately.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
2 
 2. Definitions : Unless the subject or the context otherwise requires, in this 
Act, -  
(a)  "Chairperson" means the Chairperson of the Commission 
 and the word also includes the member working as the 
 Acting Chairperson.  
(b)  "Commission" means the National Dalit Commission 
 established under Article 255 of the Constitution.  
(c)  ……………  
(d)  "Prescribed" or "As prescribed" means laws prescribed or 
 as prescribe d under the Rules framed under this Act.  
(e)  "Dalit Community" means the community as defined by 
 the Government of Nepal on the basis of the 
 recommendation  made by the Commission.  
(f)  "Member" means the member of the Commission and the 
 word also includes the Chairperson.  
(g)  "Constitution" means the Constitution of Nepal.  
 
Chapter -2 
Power, Functions and Duties of the Commission  
 
3. Power, Functions and Duties of the Commission : The power, 
function and duties of the Commission in addition to t he power, 
                                                           
  Removed by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
3 
 function and duties of the Commission prescribed in Article 256  of the 
Constitution shall be as follows: -  
(a)  to review, monitor and evaluate the policy and programs 
 related with the Dalit Community,  
(b) to conduct study and research  on the prevailing legal 
provisions  relating to the Dalit  for the  protection and  
promot ion of  the rights, interests and the empowerment  of 
the  Dalit Community , and to make recommendation  to 
the Government of Nepal relating to the  reforms  of such 
laws , 
(c)  to make recommendations to the Government of Nepal for 
 the protection and promotion of the rights and interests of 
 the Dalit Community and the empowerment of such 
 community,  
(d)  to increase social consciousness against caste based 
 discrimination, untouchability or social malpractices or 
 thoughts, behavior, practices  that justify social 
 discrimination on the basis of caste, race  based on the 
 supremacy of any caste or based on hate that purport  any 
 caste, race or p ersons of specif ic origin  or community as 
 high or low and to prepare and distribute awareness 
 generating materials for such programs,   
(e)  to formulate and implement necessary information, notices 
 and consciousness generating programs for the protection

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
4 
  and promotion of rights and interests of the Dalit 
 Community  and the empowerment of such community ,  
(f)  to monitor the implementation of the international treaties, 
 agreements relating to the Dalit Community  that Nepal is 
 a party to , and to make recommendations or suggestions 
 for its implementation  to the Government of Nepal,  
(g)  to identify Dalit Community  by means of detailed studies 
 and research , and to make recommendations to the 
 Government of Nepal to make lists of Surnames,  
(h)  to review, monitor and evaluate the awareness generating 
 programs conducted by the Government of Nepal and other 
 institutions for the protection , promotion and 
 empowerment of the rights and interests of the Dalit 
 Community,  
(i)  to monitor, cause to monitor  the status of 
 implementation of the recommendations made by the 
 Commission,   
(j)  to formulate, implement  or cause to implement  the code of 
 conduct for the Chairperson, Members and employees of 
 the Commission,  
(k)  to approve the annual program of the Commission.  
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)  
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
5 
 4. May obtain opinion and consultations : The Commission , in relation 
to its functions and duties,  may receive opinions and seek consultations 
from any constitutional organ, gove rnment office or public entity.  
5. May obtain service of experts : The Commission may receive services 
from experts, pursuant to the federal law by stating the reasons thereof, 
if the human resource employed within the Commission is unable to  
perform any work that the Commission is required to perform as per the 
Constitution, this Act and prevailing federal law.  
6. May form  committee or working group : (1) The Commission may 
form a committee or working group to perform specific tasks  concerned 
with the Commission,  by formulating a procedure.  
(2) The terms or scope of operation of the committee or working 
grou p formed pursuant to sub -section  (1), shall be as prescribed by the 
Commission at the time of its formation.  
(3) While forming the committee or worki ng group pursuant to 
sub-section (1), there shall be representation from within the Dalit 
Community; based on the principle of proportional representation, as 
enshrined in the Constitution.  
7.  Coordination and Cooperation : The Commission may on the basis 
of necessity, coordinate and coo perate with government agencies or 
public entities.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
6 
 Chapter -3 
Procedure related to complaint  action  
 
8. Complaint may be filed : (1) A written or oral complaint may be filed 
to the Commission by the victim or anyone on behalf of the victim in 
case of caste based discrimination and untouchability committed by any 
person or organization or victimization through social malpractices or 
restriction in use of D alit rights.  
(2) Upon receiving complaints pursuant to sub -section (1), the 
Commission shall have to register such complaints in a register book as 
prescribed.  
(3) In case where the Commission receives information regarding 
matters  pursuant to sub -section (1), through any other sources, the 
Commission shall have to record such information and register it within 
a register book pursuant to sub -section (2).  
(4) No fees shall be charged for any complaints filed  in the 
Commission  in ac cordance with this Act.  
9.  Preliminary Investigation and Punishment : (1) The Commission 
shall initiate preliminary investigation over complaints received 
pursuant to sub -section (1) of Section 8 or over information received 
pursuant to sub -section (3) of Section 8.  
(2) In course of preliminary investigation conducted pursuant to 
sub-section (1), if the Commission finds prima facie , that the re has been 
an adverse impact on the  rights a nd interests of the Dalit, it may issue

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
7 
 appropriate orders to  the concerned individual, agency or official to 
immediately stop those acts.  
10.  Investigation into complaints : (1) If the preliminary investigation 
conducted pursuant to section 9, shows that the that the re has been an 
adverse impact on the  rights and interests  of the Dalit Community, the 
Commission may conduct an inves tigation by itself or cause to  
conduct , on the basis of necessity by formation of a committee  or as 
fixed by the officer of the Commission.  
(2) The Commission, investigation committee or investigation 
officer, while carrying out the investigation pursuant to sub -section (1), 
shall have the following power: -  
(a)  to avail information by calling a person before the 
 Commission,  
(b)   to order any person for the submission of any deed or 
 document or evidence,  
(c)  to inspect the site as and when necessary,  
(d)  to collect any deed or its copy , concerned with the 
 matter of investigation,  from any government or public 
 offices.  
(3) A report shall be submitted to the Commission upon the 
completion of the investigation carried out pursuant to sub -section (1).  
                                                           
  Amended by The Act Amending Some Nepal Acts 201 9 (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
8 
 (4) Other provisions reg arding the investigation of the complaints, 
shall be as prescribed.  
11. Investigation shall not be conducted : Notwithstanding anything 
contained in Sections 9 and 10,  the Commission shall not carry out 
investigation or initiate proceedings over matter tha t has been investigated 
or is being investigated by any other agency,  in accordance with prevailing 
laws.  
12.  Recommendation to file a case : (1) If the Commission finds it necessary 
to file a case on the basis of investigation conducted pursuant to Section 10, 
it shall make a recommendation to the concerned agency  to initiate a legal 
suit, within the time -limit of filing a case and notify the conc erned persons 
of the same.  
 (2) The Commission , while making a recommendation pursuant to 
sub-section (1), shall  make available  the facts, documents and copies of 
evidences colle cted in course of investigation, to the concerned agency that 
will assist in t he filing of a case .   
(3) Upon receiving the written notice requesting the filing of a case 
pursuant to subsection (1) , concerned agency  shall examine and make a 
decision as to the filing or dismissal of the case.  
13.  Complaints may be dismissed : (1) The Commission may dismiss 
complaints by stating the reasons thereof, if upon investigation conducted 
pursuant to Sections 9 and 10 , the complaint is found to be baseless.  
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
9 
 (2) If a decision to dismiss a complaint is made pursuant to 
subsection (1), the Co mmission shall have to inform the concerned  
complainant of the same , within seven days from which the decision was 
made.  
14.  Provision relating to Reconciliation : (1) Notwithstanding anything 
contained elsewhere in this Act, if the concerned parties file a joint 
petition for reconciliation with respect to any complaint that is under 
consideration in the Commission, the Commission may have them 
reconciled on matters in which the prevailing laws allow for 
reconciliation.  
(2) In matters that have been settled through reconciliation pursuant 
to sub -section (1), complaints may not be filed again in the Commission, 
except for cases where the decision  of reconciliation  has not been 
implemented.  
(3) Other provisions regarding reconciliation shall be as pres cribed.  
15. Implementation of Recommendation or Decision : (1) The 
Commission shall write to the concerned individual, agency or official 
for the implementation of the recommendations, decision or order 
issued by it, in accordance with the Constitution or this Act.  
  (2) Upon receiving such correspondence  in written form  from the 
Commission pursuant to sub -section (1), the concerned individual, agency 
or official  shall immediately implement  it and inform the Commission of 
the same.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
10 
 (3) The concerned indiv idual, agency or officials  shall immediately 
inform the Commission in case of  their inability  because of some reason to 
implement the  content of the correspondence  as written for by the 
Commission , pursuant to sub -section (1), by citing any reasons thereof.  
 (4) Upon receiving information pursuant to sub -section (3), the 
Commission  shall write to any individual, agency or official for 
reconsideration of the matter and to take a decision or for the 
implementation of any matter.  
Chapter - 4 
Operation of the Commission  
 
16.  Office of the Commission : (1) A central office of the Comm ission shall be 
established in the Kathmandu Valley for the operation of work of the 
Commission.  
(2) The Commission may,  on the basis of necessity, establish offices 
in the provinces .  
17. Meeting of the Commission : (1) The meeting of the Commission shall 
decide the activities of the Commission to be performed in accordance  with 
the Constitution and this Act.  
 (2) The meet ing of the Commission shall be held on such a date, time 
and venue as prescribed by the Chairperson, based on necessity .

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
11 
   (3) The S ecretary of the Commission shall  finalize and notify all 
members of the date, time and venue of the meeting along with a lis t of the 
agenda to be discussed in the meeting , at least 48 hours  prior to the meeting .  
 (4) Any member interested to discuss additional issues, not included 
within the list of agenda set to be discussed within the meeting pursuant to 
sub-section (3) , shall notify the S ecretary of the additional issue s and reason 
for their introduction to the meeting 24 hours prior to the meeting. Upon 
receipt of such information, the S ecretary of the Commission shall notify 
all members and such issue s shall be considered to have been included in 
the list.  
 (5) Notwithstanding anything stated in sub -sections (3) and (4), an 
issue not included within the list may be introduced and decided by the 
Commission, with the agreement of all members present in the meeting.  
 (6) The  quorum of the meeting shall be deemed to have been fulfilled 
with the presence of m ore than 50 percent , of the immediate members of 
the Commission.  
 (7) The meeting of the Comm ission shall be chaired by the 
Chairperson of the Commission.  
 (8) The decision of the majority shall be the decision of the 
Commis sion and in case of a tie, the C hairperson shall give a decisive vote.  
 (9) The S ecretary of the Commission shall create a depository of  the 
decision of the Commission, authenticating  it with the  signatures of the 
Chairperson and M embers.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
12 
   (10) The S ecretary of the Commission shall be a gazetted first class 
officer of the Nepal Civil Service. The seniormost official of t he 
Commission shall act as the S ecretary of the Commission until the 
appointment of such official.  
 (11) Other procedures related to the meeting of the Commission shall 
be as determined by the Commission.  
18.  Not to take part in the decision making in case of conflict of interest :  
If any member of the Commission has any interest, concern or benefit  
arising from any issue under consideration in the Commission or if the near 
relatives of such persons stand to benefit directly or indirectly, such 
member should give prior information to the Commission regarding such 
matters a nd such member shall not take part in the decision making process 
of the Commission concerning such matters.  
19.  Work Division : The division of t he work of the Chairperson and M ember s 
shall be as fixed by the Commission.  
20.  Work to be performed as an acting : The senior most M ember of the 
Commis sion, shall work as the acting C hairperson,  if the position of the 
Chairperson falls vacant due to any reason, is unable to perform work 
pursuant to sub -article (6) of Article 101 of the constitution,  has gone f or a 
foreign visit or is on leave for more than 7 days.   
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)  
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
13 
 21.  Work, performance of the Commission not to be interrupted : The 
vacancy of p ost of the Chairperson or any M ember shall not interrupt the 
works of the Commission.  
  .................  
Chapter -5 
Miscellaneous  
 
22.  Organizational Structure and Employees of the Commission : (1) The 
organizational structure and appointment of employees of the Commission 
shall be as prescribed by the Government of Nepal.  
 (2) The Government of Nepal shall make availab le the employees 
necessary for the Commission to perform its work.  
23.  Duties and Conduct of Post:  (1) The duties and conduct of the post to be 
adhered by the Chairperson and M embers of the Commission shall be as 
follows:  
(a) to perform the obligations of the post independently, 
impartially and honestly for the protect ion and promotion of  
the rights, interests of the Dalit community  and the 
empowerment of the Dalit Community,  
(b) n ot to commit any act that would create discord in the 
relationship between different ethnicities, communities and 
identities.  
                                                           
  Removed by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
14 
  (2) The Chairperson and the M embers  of the Commission shall 
adhere to the code of conduct as prescribed by this  Act or prevailing federal 
laws.  
24.  Cooperation to be extended : It shall be the duty of any agency or official 
with which the Commission seeks assistance, to cooperate with the 
Commission in course of the performance of its functions.   
25.  Power to send for implementation  in writing : If the Commission finds 
that any agency or official has  deliberately  not implemented  the order, 
decision or recommendation  made by the Commission in accordance with 
the powers conferred to it under the Constitution or this Act or has not 
assisted the Commission, it  shall have the pow er to write  to the higher 
agency or official above such agency or official for assistance in the matter.                                                                                           
26.  Annual report : The annual report to be submitted by the C ommission to 
the President, pursuant to Article 294 of the Constitution, shall inter -alia, 
include the following matters, in addition to other details:  
(a)  Details of implementation of annual program s of the 
 Commission  and expenses incurred,  
(b)  Details of complaints filed with the Commission and 
 the decisions taken and orders given with regards to 
 them by the Commission,  
(c)  Details of suggestions, recommendations given by the 
 Commission to Nepal Government or any other 
 agency ,

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
15 
 (d)  The status  of th e implementation  of the suggestions, 
 recommendations given  in accordance to clause (c),   
(e)  Situation of physical and economic resources of the 
 Commission and their utilization,  
(f)  Details of oth er activities performed by the 
 Commission in course of fulfill ing the responsibilities 
 required of it, pursuant to this Act.  
27.  Liaison with Government of Nepal : The Ministry of Federal Affairs and 
General Administration  shall liaise the Commission with the Government 
of Nepal.  
28.  Delegation of Power : The Commission may delegate some a uthority 
 accorded to it by the Constitution and this Act, as per necessity, with set 
 conditions  for its use and adherence to the Chairperson, Member, 
 Government of Nepal, State Go vernment, official employee of any agency 
 or Local Government.  
29.  Power to frame rules : (1) The Commission may frame necessary rules for 
the implementation of this Act.  
 (2) The Commission shall have to get the approval of the 
Government of Nepal, Ministry of Finance , while making rules pursuant 
to subsection (1), on matters that impose financial burden or liability to  the 
Government of Nepal.  
                                                           
  Amended by The Act  Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
16 
  (3) The rules made pursuant to sub -section (1) shall come into force, 
from the date of publication in the Nepal Gazette.  
30.  Power to frame Directives : The Commission may, subject to this Act or 
rules framed under this Act, issue directives to conduct or cause to conduct 
the smooth operation of its work.  
31.  ...................  
32. Protection  of the act ion taken in Good  Faith : No legal proceedings shall 
be initiated against the Members of the Commission, employees or any 
person deputed by the Commission for any act ion performed under this Act 
or rules framed under this Act, in good faith.  
33. Repeal and Savings : (1) Nati onal Dalit Commission , formed in 
accordance to the notice published in the Nepal Gazzette on Chaitra 6, 2058 
B.S., is hereby repealed.  
 (2) The acts and actions performed by the Commission  pursuant to 
sub-section (1), shall be deemed to have been performed  under this Act.  
 (3) The members appointed under the National Dalit Commission , 
pursuant to sub -section (1), shall be discharged from their post  
automatically, with the operation of this A ct.  
 
 
 
                                                           
  Repealed by the The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
17 
  Schedule
